name: Unblinded
description:
What is this about?:
          In this split-screen local multiplayer you must grab a friend and collaborate to escape a dark labyrinth, where each player is in a different but identical place.

          One of you has night vision, the other has thermal vision. With this two different ways to see the world collaboration is essential. Why? Because you cannot escape on your own. The mechanisms that open the doors don't open yours, they open your partner's doors.

Controls:

         Night vision player:

         W: Forward | S: Backwards | A: Left | D: Right | Q: Rotate Left | E: Rotate right

         Thermal vision player:

         Direction arrows to move and mouse movement to look around.

Creative Statement:
          This dependancy creates a collaboration dynamic that makes people want to help their partner. Helping your partner is helping yourself, which is a message that we all should consider more often.

          The two types of vision, one night vision, the other thermal vision strengthens the idea of having to different visions of the world. Even if the labyrinth that each player wanders is identical to the other, it will be completely different to each one of them, because they are not seeing things the same way.

          The necessary collaboration united with the two types of vision creates a unique combination that will create a connection between the two players by realizing that one cannot thrive without the other.

Current State of Progress:

          This game is currently in development. May not represent the final game.
